arm_group.description: everolimus dosing to tough level 6-10 ng/ml
Tacrolimus dosing to target tough level 5-10 ng/ml

brief_summary.textblock:
The calcineurin inhibitor drugs including cyclosporin and tacrolimus are well-known as
      nephrotoxicity. However, these drugs are essential for kidney transplant especially in high
      immunological risks. To date, however, there is an alternative regimen by using of
      everolimus-based which showing less toxicity than tacrolimus-based regimen by its
      mechanisms. Of note, this study aims to evaluate the toxicity by using microRNA profiles
      detection between everolimus-based and tacrolimus-based immunosuppressive regimen in kidney
      transplantation.

clinical_study.brief_title: MicroRNA Expression in Everolimus-based Versus Tacrolimus-based Regimens in Kidney Transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
The author aims to evaluate the effects of two regimens (everolimus-based versus
      tacrolimus-based) in kidney transplantation recipients. Both of regimens are prescribed only
      in recipents who have low immunologicla risks. After informed consent, all eligible
      recipients will be collected blood and urine sample for microRNA profile testing during
      study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who have given informed consent to participate in the study

          -  Actual eGFR > 20-25 ml/min/1.73 m2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Multi-organ transplantation

          -  Pregnancy

          -  ABO incompatible blood group

          -  Second, third, fouth kidney transplantation

          -  HIV positive, active or carrier in any infections

intervention.description: Everolimus dosing to target tough level 6-10 mg/ml
Tacrolimus dosing to target tough level 5-10 ng/ml

clinical_study.official_title: MicroRNA Expression in Everolimus-based Versus Tacrolimus-based Maintenance Immunosuppressive Regimens in Kidney Transplantation

primary_outcome.description: microRNA profiles including rejection and nephrotoxicity markers

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Pathology studies including rejection, interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
